net.gree.asdk.api
Class GreePlatform

java.lang.Object
  net.gree.asdk.api.GreePlatform

public class GreePlatform
extends java.lang.Object

This class has a weak singleton pattern. You can create a new GreePlatform at any point, which is cached in a static. Obtain this with instance().

Author:
GREE, Inc.

Field Detail

GREEPLATFORM_ARGS

public static final java.lang.String GREEPLATFORM_ARGS

The Bundle's extra key alias name when launch GreePlatform Application.

When launch application in especial situation, notify additional parameters to ownself throuth this hash key.
for example, launch request/message detail page on notification or launch local notification.
the way of getting parameter is the following:
Sample Code: 

 public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
   super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);

    Bundle extras = getIntent().getExtras();
    if (extras != null) {
      if (extras.containsKey(GreePlatform.GREEPLATFORM_ARGS)) {
        String args = extras.getString(GreePlatform.GREEPLATFORM_ARGS);
        Toast.makeText(getApplicationContext(), "GREEARGS:" + args, Toast.LENGTH_LONG).show();
      }
    }
  }

See Also:

initialize

public static void initialize(Context context,
                              java.lang.String appId,
                              java.lang.String encryptedKey,
                              java.lang.String encryptedSecret,
                              java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> options,
                              boolean debug)
Initialize GreePlatform SDK. Call this once before using SDK features.

Parameters:
context - The Context the application is to run it.
appId - 'Client Application ID' for this application
encryptedKey - encrypted 'Consumer Key' for this application
encryptedSecret - encrypted 'Consumer Secret' for this application
options - Additional options (See GreePlatformSettings), this can be null.
debug - Flag for debug mode.

Parameters:

appId - 'Client Application ID' for this application
key - encrypted 'Consumer Key' for this application
secret - encrypted 'Consumer Secret' for this application
options - It can be null.
debug - Flag for debug mode.

initialize

public static void initialize(Context context,
                              int optionsResourceId,
                              java.lang.String asset)
Initialize GreePlatform SDK. Call this once before using SDK features. The configuration file should be placed in your res/xml directory, or you can put the configuration in a JSON file in assets/ directory.

Parameters:
context - the application context
optionsResourceId - the Resource Id for the xml configuration file
asset - Optional path to the JSON asset file

loadOptionsFromXmlResource

public static boolean loadOptionsFromXmlResource(java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> defaults,
                                                 int resourceID,
                                                 boolean ignoreExceptions)
Loads options from an XML resource file.

Parameters:
defaults - Options used as a base. Content of file overwrites these for matching keys.
resourceID - The resource ID (R.xml....) for the XML file to load.
ignoreExceptions - True to avoid issuing exceptions, returning false on failures.
Returns:
true if the options were loaded, false otherwise

Returns:

activityOnCreate

public static void activityOnCreate(Activity activity,
                                    boolean lockedOrientation)
Survive known bug for pre-Honeycomb. @see issue-6191 Call this in every Activity.onCreate(). Plus do this in every activity: 
  protected void onDetachedFromWindow() { 
    if (apiLevel == 7) {
      try { super.onDetachedFromWindow();
      } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
        // Quick catch and continue on api level 7 (Eclair 2.1)
        DLog.w( TAG,"Android project  issue 6191  workaround." ); 
      }
    } else {
      super.onDetachedFromWindow();
    }
or simply: 
 protected void onDetachedFromWindow() {
 try { super.onDetachedFromWindow(); } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {}
 }

Parameters:
activity - your activity
lockedOrientation - true if the orientation of your activity is locked, false otherwise

getLocalUserId

public static java.lang.String getLocalUserId()
The local user id representing the currently authenticated GREE user.
This is available after notifying Authorizer.AuthorizeListener.onAuthorized() when calling Authorizer.authorize() for the first time.

Returns:
If success, return the current user id string, otherwise return null.

getLocalUser

public static GreeUser getLocalUser()
The local user object representing the currently authenticated GREE User.
This is available after notifying Authorizer.UpdatedLocalUserListener.onUpdateLocalUser() when calling Authorizer.authorize() for the first time.

Returns:
If success, return the current GreeUser class, otherwise return null.

updateBadgeValues

public static void updateBadgeValues(GreePlatform.BadgeListener listener)
This method will update the notification badges to the latest values. You need only to pass the listener the first time you call this method, as it will be kept as a weakReference.

Parameters:
listener - (optional) this listener will receive the latest updated value. This listener will be called every time the value is updated.

getBadgeValues

public static int getBadgeValues()
Get the most recently updated values of the notification badges. Note that this method is a simple value getter. It will not try to update the badge count with the server. Use updateBadgeValues(net.gree.asdk.api.GreePlatform.BadgeListener) to update the value with the server.

Returns:
the number of unread notifications for this application.
